channel.title: Richard M. Stallma on Tech Shinobi
channel.description: Recent content in Richard M. Stallma on Tech Shinobi

item.title: Cheapskate's Homebrew AI Lab
item.description: Old Stories The computer hardware used to be more playful and worth tinkering. My favorate platfom from a decade ago, Sandy Bridge on LGA 1155, can still be powerful even today. Back in the days, I used to repair people’s electronics for free. Because of that, I also received a lots of spares and e-waste in exchange. One of the best was a LGA 1155 motherboard with i5-2300 on it. Then, I bought a cheap E3-1245 and GTX 750 Ti to make it a gaming rig.
